channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description:
@JRubinBlogger that's the susan collins defense. oops i was fooled again. but it obviously isn't true of her, how could she be so stupid to be fooled so many times, and honestly i don't think it's true of journalism either.
@JRubinBlogger the rational view says that news is controlled by oligarchs, and they don't like democracy, don't trust it, and don't see any reason they should stick their necks out for it.

I didn't coin the term web 2.0, but i didn't object to it either, because what we were doing was realizing the vision of the web from the guy who invented it, who wanted it to be two-way, that people wouldn't just read stuff on the web, they would also write stuff.
that was my first impulse when i understood what the web was, that and "how do I create something for this?" luckily that was very easy, amazingly easy. once i saw that i started telling everyone that this was the future.
so i'm open to the idea of tech being used for new things. so now there's this thing they call "web3" which better be pretty great because it says it's better than the web, right? it ought to have something to do with the web too, or why call it web3?
so i've been listening and listening and i still have no clue what it is, and how i would develop the equivalent of a website for it or a web app.
all i here is a bunch of proclamations about how it's the future mostly by people who don't create anything.
so my opinion so far is it's a way for vc's to make their money without any technology at all, no need to employ programmers, or support users, just create new currency and get people to give them money for it.
how that is supposed to be the web, well i don't think it does have anything to do with the web, other than it's a name people can argue over and that gives their idea heat, and drives interest, etc.
it's just a more efficient way for vc's to make money, in other words. unless you want to show me a developer plan, for how to create a website or an app. then i'll have something to evaluate. but i honestly don't think such a thing exists.

@jochmann Yeah I was sure someone would say that. No one has to say demeaning things about a whole gender, itâ€™s a choice, itâ€™s mean and it hurts people. Itâ€™s proof that this isnâ€™t about fixing things, itâ€™s about power, the power to hurt people.
I donâ€™t think Steve wouldâ€™ve gone for this. https://t.co/r2mmx2zNYe

Wow the Washington Post sucks. https://t.co/QQnC9Mr6Uq
Women say nasty stuff about men on Twitter regularly, with impunity, and if you object, they make it personal. So I donâ€™t buy that Dave Weigel was suspended for sexism (though his joke was sexist) rather because he made a sexist joke about women.
How Brakes on Electric Cars Are Different. https://t.co/r4GSo3CpbY
Hello World
I wrote a simple Hello World app for Twitter. https://t.co/Bg2I2CbKCG You could help by giving it a try, and saying how it worked. :-)
@phonetonote @codexeditor I've been working on it my whole career. ;-)

Seriously, what OSes need is a total top to bottom rethink. What purpose do they serve. Start there. I have a feeling when theyâ€™re done theyâ€™ll find a lot of objects with relationships to other objects.
So make a great organizing editor and hang tools off it.
Otherwise known as an outliner. ðŸ™€
They need an outliner. https://t.co/GBAFK5TPx4
Warriors' Draymond Green got under Celtics' skin with antics. https://t.co/trjvH5dti9
Jan. 6 committee enlists ex-ABC News exec James Goldston for hearing. https://t.co/zB9SBYuwzc
apple's products are mostly pretty boring. and vaporware is worse than boring, it obstructs other development which is already here.
A new bookstore in Manhattan has an open podcast studio. What a great idea. I've thought about opening one myself in Woodstock, but I'm too lazy/busy with other stuff. https://t.co/71GHPfYqPm
Musk threatens to walk away from Twitter deal. https://t.co/TzBiW8IfwC
Of possible interest to @SarahSquirm. https://t.co/otnr5CjSQJ
I find any story with Seb Gorka in it amusing, even amazing. https://t.co/AmlMPa1a24
@rswilbourn thanks sands. ;-)
Draymond Green is an ass.
Jan. 6 committee privately divided on abolishing Electoral College. https://t.co/EKqZHDvU3z
Our national anthem is a terrible song.
